thread.title: Julie Bushby claims best pal Karen Matthews wasn’t ‘intelligent enough’ to mastermind Shannon kidnap plot and claims ‘others know the truth’
thread.title_full: Julie Bushby claims best pal Karen Matthews wasn’t ‘intelligent enough’ to mastermind Shannon kidnap plot and claims ‘others know the truth’

author: hchristdoloulou
title: Julie Bushby claims best pal Karen Matthews wasn’t ‘intelligent enough’ to mastermind Shannon kidnap plot and claims ‘others know the truth’
text:
Julie Bushby, who led the campaign to find Shannon, believes others were involved in the plot PA:Press Association Archive She said Matthews wasn’t intelligent enough to mastermind the fake kidnapping News Group Newspapers Ltd Karen is pictured here in 2008 as the search for her nine-year-old daughter Shannon continued 
Karen Matthews' friends open up about Sheridan Smith playing her in new BBC drama Moorside 
The shop worker, who mounted searches for nine-year-old Shannon in 2008 when she vanished, told the Mirror there are three others involved in the plot that saw Matthews locked up for eight years. 
She explained: "I think there are at least three other people who know far more than they let on. This is a horrible conspiracy of silence and it’s time for those people to speak out and tell the truth. 
"Karen was not intelligent enough to think it up on her own. I’m not saying at all what she did was right, or that she was totally innocent, but she’s not evil. PA:Press Association Archive Shannon Matthews went missing as she went home from a swimming lesson in 2008 News Group Newspapers Ltd 9 The Sun offered up a £50,000 reward for finding Shannon, championed by Matthews Shannon Matthews’ mum Karen Matthews and dad Leon Rose appeal to the public for help finding their daughter 
"This was never about the reward money, something else was going on. We need the truth now.” 
Julie, who lived on the same estate as the family in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, said her suspicions over Matthews' involvement grew when Shannon was found alive. 
Matthews had moved her daughter out of the home she shared with Meehan in secret, but pressure from neighbours on the Moorside estate led her to report the child as missing, Julie claimed. related stories 'IT WON'T BE LONG BEFORE THEY FALL OUT' Karen Matthews in 'constant pain' from 'black and decaying' teeth after chocolate and sweets jail diet BBC MOORSIDE DRAMA What's happened to 'Britain's most hated mum' since BBC drama The Moorside aired? 'I KNEW SHE WASN'T MISSING' Karen Matthews admits lying about Shannon's disappearance in chilling police interview A COLD CASE Here's everything you need to know about episode two of Shannon Matthews drama, The Moorside 'FIND SHANNON' What happened to Shannon Matthews after the notorious fake kidnapping which gripped the nation? 
But after raising the alarm, she was then tied to the lie. 
Hundreds of neighbours joined the search for little Shannon after Matthews claimed she had vanished on her way home from a swimming lesson. 
The hunt cost West Yorkshire Police £3.2million and lasted 24 days. 
But Shannon was eventually found tethered and drugged inside the base of a double bed at the grotty home of Meehan's uncle Michael Donovan almost a month after she disappeared. PA:Press Association Karen, the mother of missing 9-year-old Shannon Matthews, pictured holding her daughter's favourite teddy bear as she made an emotional appeal for her safe return News Group Newspapers Ltd Julie doesn't believe Matthews was working alone in the kidnap plot Rex Features Julie speaking on TV about her theory, with a picture of Sheridan Smith, who plays her in the drama, behind her Trailer for episode 2 of The Moorside - drama based on Shannon Matthews case 
They had planned to release the schoolgirl, ‘discover her’ then take her to a police station and claim the reward before splitting. 
But Julie has disputed this theory, and has said Karen was trying to get away from Craig. PA:Press Association Karen with ex-boyfriend Craig Meehan, then 22, outside their home in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire 1 9 The cast of the BBC drama which retells the story of nine-year-old Shannon's kidnap 
She told the Radio Times that the key to understanding Karen is she is "a child in an adult's body". 
Julie describes the mum as "stupid, not evil" and is convinced that her motive was not for the money. 
Even after Karen was found guilty and sent to prison, Julie was the one person to visit her. 
She says she did so as although she wanted answers, Karen was "a mate" and because Julie felt she "must be so lonely". Karen Matthews admits lying about Shannon's disappearance in chilling police interview
